intro: Linosyris amblystachya, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed linosyris, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of central and southern Europe. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered with fine hairs. Linosyris amblystachya is adapted to survive in dry conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
